    • Constructor Detail

      • PrecomputedOTClient

        public PrecomputedOTClient(int partyId,
                           int lowWaterMark,
                           PseudorandomGenerator prg,
                           StreamingRandomOracle H)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        partyId - whether we are party 0 or 1
        lowWaterMark - if number of available OTs goes below this number, callback is called to request more. methods will block indefinitely when no OTs are available.
        prg - a PseudorandomGenerator. Note: PRGs keep state so should not be shared between threads.
        H - a random oracle instance. Note: Oracles may keep state so should not be shared between threads.

      • setReserved

        public void setReserved(int reservedChoice,
                        int reservedSending)
        Set number of reserved choice and sending OTs. The send(BitMatrix, BitMatrix) and receive(BitMatrix) methods will not allow use of these (this is useful if the same queue is used elsewhere, as is the case with OTExtensionServer).
        Parameters:
        reservedChoice -
        reservedSending -

      • send

        public void send(byte[] x0,
                 byte[] x1)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: OT1of2.Sender
        Execute an OT transaction as the Sender. The Chooser will be able to learn one (and only one) of the two inputs, while the sender learns nothing about the Chooser's choice.
        Specified by:
        send in interface OT1of2.Sender
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        OT1of2.Chooser.receive(int)

      • send

        public void send(BitMatrix x0,
                 BitMatrix x1)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Use the precomputed random OTs to send. This method performs a block of OTs at once: each row in the matrices corresponds to a single OT. Note that the matrices must have the same size. Given a m*n matrix (m columns, n rows), n OTs of m-bit strings are performed.
        Specified by:
        send in interface BulkOT.Sender
        Parameters:
        x0 -
        x1 -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • receive

        public BitMatrix receive(BitMatrix choices)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Use the precomputed OTs to receive. Performs a block of OTs at once.
        Specified by:
        receive in interface BulkOT.Receiver
        Parameters:
        choices - a vector of choice bits. The number of OTs in the block is the number of columns in this vector.
        Returns:
        An m*n matrix (m columns, n rows), where n is the number of OTs and m the string length. Each row of the matrix is the result of an OT with the corresponding choice bit.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • receive

        public byte[] receive(int idx)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: OT1of2.Chooser
        Execute an OT transaction as the Chooser. The Chooser selects which of the two Sender inputs to learn. The sender will not learn anything about the Chooser's input.
        Specified by:
        receive in interface OT1of2.Chooser
        Parameters:
        idx - Can be either 0 or 1
        Returns:
        input x[idx] (where x is the input vector to OT1of2.Sender.send(byte[], byte[]))
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        OT1of2.Sender.send(byte[], byte[])

      • receiveWritingPhase

        public org.factcenter.qilin.protocols.generic.PrecomputedOTClient.ReceiveState receiveWritingPhase(BitMatrix choices)
                                                                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: BulkOT.SplitReceiver
        Start a receive operation This phase should perform writes to the comm channel but no reads. To complete the operation, the user must call BulkOT.SplitReceiver.receiveReadingPhase(State) with the state returned by this method call.
        Specified by:
        receiveWritingPhase in interface BulkOT.SplitReceiver
        Parameters:
        choices - a vector corresponding to the receiver's choices in each OT.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
